text: Theodore Nathan Lerner (October 15, 1925 - February 12, 2023) was an American real estate developer. He was the managing principal owner of the Washington Nationals baseball team. He was the founder of the real estate company Lerner Enterprises, the largest private landowner in the Washington metropolitan area as well as Chelsea Piers in New York City. In 2015, Forbes magazine named him the richest person in Maryland, with a net worth of over $5 billion. Lerner died from pneumonia at his home in Chevy Chase, Maryland on February 12, 2023, at age 97. ==References== Category:1925 births Category:2023 deaths Category:Real estate developers Category:Businesspeople from Washington, D.C. Category:Businesspeople from Maryland Category:Deaths from pneumonia
title: Ted Lerner
